p: Approximately nine of ten children under 2 years old have experienced an episode of otitis [ 37]. The usual viral etiologies are respiratory syncytial virus, parainfluenza (types 1â€“3), influenza (A and B), enterovirus, and rhinovirus [ 38]; however, the distribution of pathogens differs by age and location. Exposure to day care or a family member with a URI may be a predisposing factor.
